title: ICC to open war crimes cases over Russia's invasion, reports say
description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) is planning to open two war crimes cases tied to the Russian invasion of Ukraine and issue arrest warrants against "several people," according to the New York Times (NYT) and Reuters, citing current and former officials with knowledge of the decision who were not authorized to speak publicly.

title: Large group attempts mass entry into US at border crossing
description: A large group of people in Mexico approached a US border entry point in El Paso, Texas, in an attempt at mass entry into the country, US Customs and Border Protection said.

title: 'Absolutely idiotic'. SVB insider says employees angry with CEO
description: The blame game is on for who caused Silicon Valley Bank's collapse, and the tech sector is pointing the finger at SVB CEO Greg Becker for allowing his company to go down in history as the second-biggest US banking failure on record.

title: China looms large as Biden makes submarine moves with UK and Australia
description: President Joe Biden will be flanked on Monday by a 377-foot submarine -- the USS Missouri -- as he announces an accelerated timeline for Australia to receive its own nuclear-powered submarines early next decade.

title: The tech industry avoided an 'extinction-level event,' but it's not unscathed
description: For much of the weekend, Silicon Valley scrambled to find a way through what one prominent tech investor described as an "extinction-level event for startups" after the collapse of a top lender in the industry.

title: Mexico's president says Mexico is safer than the US
description: Mexico is a safer country than the United States, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador argued on Monday, weeks after the high-profile kidnapping of four Americans drew global attention to the country's security crisis.

title: Britain's treasured BBC is engulfed in an impartiality storm of its own making
description: The jaunty theme tune to "Match of the Day," the BBC's flagship Saturday night soccer show, has been whistled by British viewers since its first edition aired in 1964.

title: Skeletal remains of Roman aristocrat discovered in hidden lead coffin
description: The remains of a Roman aristocrat have been unearthed by archaeologists in northern England.

title: Why Silicon Valley Bank collapsed and what it could mean
description: Silicon Valley Bank collapsed with astounding speed on Friday. Investors are now on edge about whether its demise could spark a broader banking meltdown.

title: Angela Bassett held Austin Butler's hand during the best actor Oscar presentation
description: Angela Bassett plays a queen and mother in the "Black Panther" franchise and she was giving that energy Sunday night at the Academy Awards.

title: Biden outlines consequences for failed banks' executives
description: President Joe Biden addressed the nation to reassure Americans that the banking system is safe after the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

title: Europe's banking stocks suffer biggest drop in a year
description: Investors dumped European bank stocks for a third straight day Monday, despite dramatic moves over the weekend by the US and UK governments to shore up confidence in the financial system following Friday's collapse of Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Water disasters on both ends of the spectrum -- dry and wet -- are getting more intense as planet warms, study finds
description: From lengthy droughts to severe flooding, the intensity of water-related disasters around the world has increased over the last two decades as global temperatures climbed to record levels, according to new research.

title: 3-year-old girl fatally shoots 4-year-old sister with unsecured firearm in Texas
description: A 3-year-old girl fatally wounded her 4-year-old sister in an unintentional shooting in Texas, Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez said.

title: A Saudi-Iran reconciliation may ripple across the region. Here's why
description: Saudi Arabia and Iran have given each other just two months to prove they are serious about Friday's surprise agreement to normalize ties.

title: Poor sleep decreases vaccine effectiveness, especially for men
description: If you're scheduling an appointment for a vaccination — whether for Covid-19, the flu or for travel to another country — make sure you're getting a long, restful night's slumber before you head to the doctor.

title: See which former Trump official is reaching out to other campaigns ahead of 2024
description: CNN's Alayna Treene reports that former Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski has been reaching out to other GOP campaigns ahead of the 2024 presidential race.

title: Kansas men's basketball coach Bill Self released from hospital; expected to coach in NCAA tournament
description: Bill Self, the head coach of Kansas men's basketball, has been released from the hospital and is expected to rejoin the team and coach in NCAA tournament this coming week, the school announced on Sunday.

title: Athletic Bilbao fans protest improper payment allegations against Barcelona during La Liga game
description: Athletic Bilbao fans threw fake bank notes onto the pitch inside the San Mamés Stadium to signal their displeasure with the alleged payment scandal surrounding La Liga rival Barcelona.

title: 'Shark Tank' star shares biggest lesson from the SVB collapse
description: Kevin O'Leary, chairman of O'Leary Ventures and host on "Shark Tank," gives his takeaways on what led to the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and how it will affect customers and investors.

title: Trump won't testify before NY grand jury investigating hush money scheme, lawyer says
description: Former President Donald Trump does not plan to testify in a New York grand jury investigation into his alleged role in a scheme to pay hush money to adult film star Stormy Daniels, Trump's attorney told CNN on Monday.

title: Toy store CEO turns to customers for help after SVB collapse
description: CNN anchor Poppy Harlow speaks with Ben Kaufman, CEO & co-founder of Camp, a toy company that got caught up in the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and is asking customers for help to keep it afloat.

title: Biden administration will approve Willow oil project in Alaska with three drilling pads instead of two
description: The Biden administration is set to approve the controversial ConocoPhillips Willow oil drilling project in Alaska with three drilling pads instead of two, two government sources familiar with the details confirmed.

title: Scottie Scheffler's 88-year-old grandma walks every hole of his dominant victory
description: It is said that a Grandma knows best. Scottie Scheffler, newly crowned The Players Championship winner, would agree wholeheartedly.

title: What it was like inside the Vanity Fair Oscar Party
description: With the third anniversary of the start of Covid-19 lockdowns coming up this month, Oscar Sunday this year felt like a time stars were finally more relaxed and open to being out and about and mingling. That freewheeling ease was in full effect at the Vanity Fair Oscar Party in Beverly Hills overnight.

title: Aaron Rodgers speaks out on his future with trade talk intensifying
description: After holding talks with the New York Jets, it appears that there could be light at the end of the tunnel for Aaron Rodgers after emerging from the dark.

title: Stanford University police launch hate crime investigation after antisemitic drawing found
description: The placing of an antisemitic drawing in a dormitory at Stanford University is being investigated by campus police as a hate crime, officials said.

title: Arizona State Sun Devils celebrate reaching March Madness by jumping into swimming pool
description: There's no better way to celebrate than going for a quick dip, as the Arizona State Sun Devils men's basketball team displayed on Sunday evening.

title: How Silicon Valley Bank collapsed in 48 hours
US and UK authorities are working to prevent wider financial chaos after Friday's crisis — the biggest failure of a US bank since 2008
Nobel Prize-winning Japanese novelist Kenzaburo Oe dies at 88
description: Japanese Nobel Prize-winning author Kenzaburo Oe, a writer who was renowned for a strong pacifist stance that weaved its way into much of his work, has died of "old age", his publisher confirmed Monday.

title: Vice President Kamala Harris to visit Africa later this month
description: Vice President Kamala Harris will travel to Africa later this month, her office announced Monday, becoming the most senior Biden administration official to visit the continent.

title: The US president plans to address Americans this morning about his administration's emergency response to the failure of two banks
description: The Biden administration's scramble to prevent financial contagion from the crash of Silicon Valley Bank is both an attempt to shield a resilient but still-vulnerable economy and to prevent grave political fallout.

title: Gary Lineker allowed back on BBC after impartiality storm
description: Gary Lineker will resume his duties on the BBC's flagship soccer show after an impartiality storm over his criticism of the government's asylum policy that plunged Britain's public broadcaster into scheduling chaos over the weekend.

title: Here's how many times you need to reuse your reusable grocery bags
description: The battle against the single-use plastic bag may not be won but it's definitely under way.

title: China's new premier tries to reassure private sector amid widespread concerns about future
description: China's new premier has tried to reassure the private sector in his debut press conference, as concerns grew about the country's future policy direction with the introduction of a new cabinet loyal to leader Xi Jinping.

title: HSBC is buying SVB's UK business for just over $1
description: HSBC has scooped up the UK arm of Silicon Valley Bank for £1 ($1.2), just days after its business in the United States collapsed in stunning fashion.

title: Trump will campaign in Iowa as decision on criminal charges against him looms
description: Former President Donald Trump will travel to Iowa on Monday for the first time since announcing his third White House bid as Manhattan prosecutors near a decision on whether to charge him over his alleged role in a hush money scheme and cover-up.

title: 'A monster in uniform': How police failures allowed an elite UK officer to commit multiple sex offenses
Taiwan says soldier who went missing has been found in China
description: A Taiwanese soldier who went missing last week from an island near the Chinese coast has been found in mainland China, a Taiwan official said on Monday, raising the possibility of a highly unusual defection amid heightened tensions across the Taiwan Strait.

title: 'Mom, I just won an Oscar!' 'Everything Everywhere All At Once' actor
description: "Everything Everywhere All At Once" won seven Oscars at the 95th Academy Awards. The winners, including actors and directors, spoke emotionally about what their wins mean to them.

title: Lady Gaga wows Oscars in fresh off the runway Versace gown
description: Lady Gaga took the term "fresh off the runway" to another level at the Oscars by arriving at Sunday's ceremony in a gown Gigi Hadid had debuted for Versace just three days earlier.

title: Major night for Asian representation, with historic wins for 'Everything Everywhere' and 'RRR'
description: The 95th Academy Awards were a major night for Asian representation on the silver screen with a series of milestones, including the first Asian woman to take a best actress gong and the first ever Oscar wins for Indian productions.

title: Xi Jinping vows to make China's military a 'great wall of steel' in first speech of new presidential term
description: China's leader Xi Jinping on Monday vowed to bolster national security and build the military into a "great wall of steel," in the first speech of his precedent-breaking third term as president.

title: 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' dominates with 7 wins, including best actress for Michelle Yeoh and best picture
description:
• Full list of Oscar nominees
• Inside the making of an Oscar statuette
• Video: The weird way Oscar votes are counted
• #OscarsSoMale? Women shut out of the directing category

title: 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' dominates Oscars with 7 wins
Rihanna brings bold maternity style to the Oscars
description: Dressed in a sheer, form-fitting gown, Rihanna arrived on the Oscars' champagne-colored carpet with her baby bump proudly on display — her first high-profile public appearance since last month's Super Bowl.

title: Jimmy Kimmel jokes about needing to feel safe as Oscars host
description: Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel didn't resist sprinkling jokes about last year's infamous conflict between Will Smith and Chris Rock. Smith slapped host Chris Rock live on-stage after the comedian joked about his wife.

title: US regulators bail out SVB customers as second bank fails
Russian air defenses shoot down 4 missiles over Belgorod, governor says
'A monster in uniform': How police failures allowed an elite UK officer to commit multiple sex offenses
description: David Carrick, a serial sex offender, served in one of Britain's most elite armed police units for years. He is now behind bars, but his ability to evade justice has only fueled a growing distrust and anger toward police in the United Kingdom. CNN has investigated how failures may have prevented Carrick from being stopped sooner.

title: Chinese companies rush to calm investors
description: The collapse of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB), which courted Chinese start-ups, has caused widespread concern in China, where a string of founders and companies rushed to appease investors by saying their exposure was insignificant or nonexistent.

title: Swell life: China's surf scene is heating up
RRR's 'Naatu Naatu' wins award for best original song
description:

• Video: The weird way Oscar votes are counted

title: Michelle Yeoh makes history with best actress win
description: Michelle Yeoh has won best actress at the 95th Academy Awards on Sunday night, becoming the first woman of Asian descent to win the award.

title: Brendan Fraser wins best actor for 'The Whale'
description: Brendan Fraser tearfully accepted the Academy Award for best actor for his role in the film "The Whale" on Sunday.

title: Ke Huy Quan gives emotional speech after winning best supporting actor
description:

title: Nepal bans solo trekkers throughout the country
description: Five years after banning solo adventurers from climbing Mount Everest, Nepal's government has extended the restriction to the whole country.

title: 'The Last of Us' finale comes down to a hard choice that's really no choice at all
description: What if potentially saving the world came down to sacrificing an innocent teenager? That was the brutal choice presented by the season finale of "The Last of Us," and the destination, with the benefit of hindsight, to which every step of this road had been leading.

title: Jimmy Kimmel jokes about 'the slap' and introduces celebrity 'crisis team' in Oscars monologue
description: Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel kicked off the show by introducing some unofficial members of the ceremony's "crisis team" to prevent any unexpected outbursts -- and the crew included the Mandalorian, a Spider-Man and Steven Spielberg.

title: This is how SVB depositors will get their money back
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen instructed the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation to guarantee Silicon Valley Bank customers will have access to all of their money starting Monday. CNN's Arlette Saenz reports.

title: Opinion: Mike Pence's hypocrisy knows no bounds in his strongest rebuke of Trump to date
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence's speech Saturday night at the annual Gridiron Club Dinner in Washington, DC, served up a few laughs, some kernels of truth and a massive helping of hypocrisy.
